title: Lara Trump won't run for Senate, even with the president's backing
shortDescription: North Carolina is a pivotal battleground state and the Senate race is one of the premier contests of the upcoming midterm elections.

title: Ghislaine Maxwell lawyer says he hopes President Trump pardons her
shortDescription: The comment came after Trump was asked if he was considering pardoning the convicted sex trafficking associate of Jeffrey Epstein

title: Independent voters push Trump's approval rating to second-term low
shortDescription: President Donald Trump's approval rating has dropped to 37%, according to a new Gallup poll, the lowest mark of his second term.

title: Trump eyes rebates from tariff revenue
shortDescription: President Donald Trump says his administration is considering taxpayer rebates as the White House says tariffs have raked in over $100 billion.

title: Trump administration withheld billions from schools – until now
shortDescription: The Trump administration will begin to disburse school funds to states next week.

title: 16% of voters approve of Trump's handling of Epstein files, poll shows
shortDescription: Voters were surveyed for a new Emerson College poll about President Donald Trump's handling of key issues, including the Jeffrey Epstein case.

title: Trump vs. The Wall Street Journal
shortDescription: After The Wall Street Journal published an exclusive on an apparent letter written to Jeffrey Epstein, President Trump went to battle.

title: Trump on Maxwell pardon: 'I'm allowed to do it'
shortDescription: President Donald Trump says he hasn’t considered pardoning Ghislaine Maxwell amid renewed scrutiny over Epstein files.

title: Why is Trump going to Scotland? It may be an unfriendly welcome
shortDescription: President Donald Trump is headed to Scotland for golf and trade talks. Protesters in the UK are reminding him of his Jeffrey Epstein problems.

title: Trump accused Obama of treason. Now the president says 'he owes me.'
shortDescription: Obama's debt to Trump in the current president's mind? That the U.S. Supreme Court ruled last year that presidents have immunity for official acts.

title: Trump considers 'rebates' to US taxpayers from tariff income
shortDescription: President Donald Trump said he is considering rebates to US taxpayers from billions in tariff revenue flowing into the country.

title: Trump says he hasn't considered pardoning Ghislaine Maxwell
shortDescription: Ghislaine Maxwell, an associate of Jeffrey Epstein, is meeting with federal prosecutors again on July 25.

title: 'We've been used as props': Veterans rally against Trump cuts
shortDescription: Veterans and protesters in Texas and Washington, D.C., rallied against the Trump administration's cuts to programs supporting veterans on the 81st anniversary of D-Day.

title: Expelled ex-congressman George Santos is off to prison
shortDescription: George Santos pleaded guilty in August 2024 to felony wire fraud and aggravated identity theft charges.

title: Trump says US will loosen rules in push to win AI race
shortDescription: The Trump administration released a new artificial intelligence blueprint that aims to loosen environmental rules and vastly expand AI exports to allies, in a bid to maintain the American edge over China in the critical technology.

title: Make gas cans great again: White House pushes for changes
shortDescription: Vapor emissions regulations were ordered after scientists noted the 80 million gas cans in the USA were a surprising source of air pollution.

title: Protests, UK prime minister await Trump during Scotland trip
shortDescription: Scotland is the birthplace of Trump’s mother and a place where he owns two golf resorts. Yet he hasn’t always had a warm reception there.

title: Inside the rise (and ugly fall) of the Trump-Epstein friendship
shortDescription: Donald Trump and Jeffrey Epstein partied together for more than a decade. One became president, the other died in jail.

title: See Columbia's extraordinary $220 million deal with Trump
shortDescription: Columbia University announced a $220 million deal with the Trump administration. Here's what's in it.
